intro: Dalechampia leucophylla, commonly known as the white-leaf dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Dalechampia leucophylla is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
